Legal_Issue: Adequacy of reasons in PRRA decision, consideration of evidence, procedural fairness
Evidence_Type: Evidence of attacks by Maoists, political instability, new evidence submitted
Legal_Provision: Section 101(1)(a) IRPA, principles of procedural fairness
Basis_of_Claim: Risk to life, liberty, security upon return
Application_Error: Failure to address major points and new evidence
Review_Outcome: Stay of removal granted pending further proceedings
Assessment_Standard: Whether decision was fair, reasonable, and adequately reasoned
Evidence_Ignored: Attacks by Maoists, political instability, practical impact of peace agreement
Application_Factor: Serious issue raised, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Decision_Outcome: PRRA claim dismissed initially, stay granted on judicial review
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether dismissal was based on adequate reasons and fair process
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: PRRA requirements for reasoned decisions and procedural fairness
Outcome_of_Review: Applicant allowed to remain in Canada pending resolution
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient reasoning, failure to consider key evidence
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to PRRA and judicial review
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to inadequate reasons and lack of engagement with evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and inadequate reasoning

Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide transparent and complete reasons
